description: From day +‎ dream. Compare West Frisian deidream (“daydream”), Dutch dagdroom (“daydream”), German Tagtraum (“daydream”), Swedish dagdröm (“daydream”), Icelandic dagdraumur (“daydream”).

entries.meaning: A spontaneous series of thoughts while awake not connected to immediate reality.
examples: Coordinate terms: woolgathering, brown study, castles in Spain

verbs.description: daydream (third-person singular simple present daydreams, present participle daydreaming, simple past and past participle daydreamt or daydreamed)

entries.meaning: (intransitive) To have such a series of thoughts; to woolgather.
examples: Stop daydreaming and get back to work!
